pages.text: Ball pythons can carry genes for abnormal traits which can be passed down from parent to offspring: these traits are called morphs.$(br2)Every morph except for normal has one of three dominance types: dominant, incomplete dominant, or recessive.

pages.title: Intro to Genetics
pages.text: When two ball pythons are bred together, the offspring's appearances will vary depending on the morphs they inherit and those morphs' types.

A morph's dominance type is determined by how the number of alleles a python has affects its appearance. Alleles are variants of a gene that are represented by letters: capital letters for dominant alleles, lowercase letters for recessive alleles.$(br2)A snake is considered homozygous if it has two copies of an allele, and heterozygous if it has only one.

pages.title: Zygosity
pages.text: In this example, the normal parent (AA) is homozygous dominant, the albino parent (aa) is homozygous recessive, and the child (Aa) is heterozygous.
